3. Flagship food brands tend to underinvest in R&D and innovation compared to other sectors, instead choosing startups and VCs to prove the concept and use M&A to purchase the end result. More and more meat companies are buying into the alternative protein space.
2. Plant based and alternative (i.e., cellular) proteins are receiving substantial investments as venture capitalists see these options as disruptive to an outdated food supply chain.

Last week I attended the very interesting Future of Food-Tech conference (https://t.co/ilOrKW3zv8) in New York where I learned about the next generation of investment in plant-based and other alternative proteins. These were my top 3 takeaways:
